description.narrative: Ansökan fokuserar på två huvudsakliga områden: 1) Partnerorganisationernas hållbarhet samt ett tematiskt fokus på 2) Kvinnor, fred och säkerhet – bestående av fredsbyggande och GBV. Projektmålet är att Kvinna till Kvinnas partnerorganisationer ökar sitt deltagande i och inflytande i offentlighet och politik. Förväntade resultat med indikatorer grupperas under de två komponenterna kapacitetsutveckling och kvinnor, fred och säkerhet. Den nuvarande ansökan avser en ett-årig förlängning av projektet under 2015. Under förlängning kommer arbetet att fortgå som tidigare men med ett större internt fokus. Tanken är att man under 2015 kommer lägga ner arbete på en strategy process dels centralt inom Kvinna till Kvinna i Stockholm men även i Georgien där man kommer att fokusera på strategisk planering och organisationsbedömningar tillsammans med sina partner organisationer. Utifrån analysen och den överenskomna strategin kommer man att arbeta fram en längre ansökan. Organisationsbedömningarna och den strategiska analysen är ämnade att öka hållbarheten av arbetet hittills och planerade insatser.

Kvinna till Kvinna (KtK) was granted support for activities in Georgia during 2013-2014, amounting to 16 MSEK. The proposal has two focus areas: 1) Sustainability of partner organisations and 2) thematic focus on women, peace and security – consisting of peace building and gender equality. The project objective is that targeted organisations have increased their presence and influence in public and political life.
The current applications concerns a one year cost extension of the programme during 2015 with 9 MSEK. During the extension the main activities of the programme will continue, however there will be a greater internal focus. KtK will during 2015 work with strategic planning both internally and with it cooperation partners. KtK will also support its partner organisations to carry out organisational assessments. Based on this strategy work and analysis KtK will formulate a new application for a longer programme starting 2016 which will include a strengthened focus on sustainability and take into account future phase out of Swedish support.

sector.narrative: Women’s rights organisations and movements, and government institutions

description.narrative: General question: Results related to the intended outcome 2015Question: Summarise results related to the intended outcome (this information will be sent to Open Aid)Answer: The results refer to the entire programme period Jan 2013 - April 2016 and the assessment is made based on the programme reporting, the impact assessment carried out in 2016 and the findings made during Sida's minotoring and follow up. The programme has contributed to a strengthened position for women in the region in certain regards. Women's organisations in Georgia have been actively participating in advocacy for policy development and legislation on national and local level with the base of the support from the programme. Some of Kvinna till Kvinna's partner organisations have also been key for developing and deepening the understanding of gender equality for law-makers in the country as well as taking up central roles as advisors and watchdogs for the implementation of the adopted legislative frameworks. The projects implemented by Kvinna till Kvinna's partner organisations (KtK POs) on the community level have had great impact in regards to changing views towards gender equality, domestic violence and LGBTIQ. Awareness raising of sexual and reproductive health has also increased. Furthermore the prevention work, and response to, domestic violence cases by of the partner organisations has improved during the programme. The impact assessment highlighted the increase in awareness and change in the public opinion concerning domestic violence as one of the mayor results on impact level. Progress has been made in terms of the objective of increased organisational development and sustainablility of Kvinna till Kvinna's partner organisations. More organisations use result based managment and have an increased level of sustainability or alternative sources of funding. These results however vary a lot between the different partner organisations. In Abkhazia a formalized network of women's organizations has been established through the programme. In South Ossesstia however, there were difficulties for the partner organisation to operate due to anti-NGO propaganda being prevalent in media and a general harder climate for civil society. As a result Kvinna till Kvinna's South Ossetian based partner organisation AWSODHR was forced to cease with their operations in 2015.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
